SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ftp

Interface FTPConnectionHandlerFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
AnonymousFTPHandlerFactory, RoleBasedFTPHandlerFactory, SimpleFTPHandlerFactory
public interface FTPConnectionHandlerFactory
A factory interface for creating FTPConnectionHandler instances.

This functional interface is used by FTPServer to create a new, dedicated FTPConnectionHandler instance for each incoming FTP connection. This ensures proper thread safety and state isolation, as handler implementations are typically stateful and not designed to be shared across multiple concurrent connections.

Example implementation: 


 // Example: A factory that creates a new MyFTPHandler for each connection
 ftpConnector.setHandlerFactory(new FTPConnectionHandlerFactory() {
     public FTPConnectionHandler createHandler() {
         return new MyFTPHandler(fileSystem, userDatabase);
     }
 });
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    FTPConnectionHandler
    createHandler()
    Creates a new instance of FTPConnectionHandler.

  • Method Details

    • createHandler

      FTPConnectionHandler createHandler() throws Exception
      Creates a new instance of FTPConnectionHandler. This method is called for every new FTP connection.
      Returns:
      a new, uninitialized FTPConnectionHandler instance
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during handler creation
